description: If true, Snowflake will automatically abort queries when it detects that the client has disappeared.
Which profiler is currently active to analyze user code for Python sprocs. Possible values are "LINE" and "MEMORY".

The autocommit property determines whether is statement should to be implicitly
wrapped within a transaction or not. If autocommit is set to true, then a 
statement that requires a transaction is executed within a transaction 
implicitly. If autocommit is off then an explicit commit or rollback is required
to close a transaction. The default autocommit value is true.

Whether autocommit feature is enabled for this client. This parameter is for
Snowflake use only.

For client metadata request(getTables()), use session catalog but multiple schemas if set to true (in conjunction with CLIENT_METADATA_REQUEST_USE_CONNECTION_CTX
Customer parameter to control threads, 0=auto

If true, client clones a new session from the previously used tokens for the account and user.
If true, client session will not expire automatically

Number of seconds to wait while trying to acquire locks, before timing out and
aborting the statement. A value of 0 turns off lock waiting i.e. the statement
must acquire the lock immediately or abort.
Whether to include dynamic tables, is_dynamic column, table kind in show objects
Whether to include dynamic tables, is_dynamic column, table kind in show commands
When true, ResultSet#getDate(int columnIndex, Calendar cal) and getDate(String columnName, Calendar cal) will display the date using the Calendar's output.
Format used to serialize query result to send back to jdbc
When scale is 0, whether to treat Decimal as Int in JDBC
When true, Timestamp_NTZ values are always stored in UTC timezone
When true, JDBC driver will not display timezone offset between JVM and session.
Width of indentation in JSON output (0 for compact)
If true, the nodejs client will convert all integer columns to bigint type
The selected language that will be used by UI, GS, Query Coordination and XP. The input languages should be in BCP-47 format. AKA. dash format.See LocaleUtil.java for the details.

Number of seconds to wait while trying to lock a resource, before timing out 
and aborting the statement. A value of 0 turns off lock waiting i.e. the 
statement must acquire the lock immediately or abort. If multiple resources 
need to be locked by the statement, the timeout applies separately to each 
lock attempt.
LOG_LEVEL to use when filtering events
METRIC_LEVEL value to control whether to emit metrics to Event Table

Number of statement included in submitted query text.
This parameter is submitted by user to avoid sql injection.
Value 1 means one statement, value > 1 means n statement
can be executed, if not equal to the value will raise the
exception. Value 0 means any number of statement can be
 executed
Whether we make NOORDER the default option for creating new sequences
Format used to serialize query result to send back to odbc
When true, enables schema caching in ODBC. This can speed up SQLColumns API calls.
When scale is 0, whether to treat Decimal as Int in ODBC
ODBC return snowflake specific sql data types in result set metadata
Format used to serialize query result to send back to python connector
True = Python Connector will use nanoarrow to convert data. False =  client will use vendored pyarrow to convert data.Only affects Python Connector >= 3.3.0
A comma separated list of modules to profile in addition to the user code, which is always profiled
The fully qualified stage name where the profiler output will be saved.
When True, Snowpark Python client will automatically clean up unused temp tables in the current session. When False, unused temp tables will not be cleaned up until the end of session.
When True, Snowpark Python client will enable the extra compilation stage that appliesoptimizations like repeated subquery elimination, large query breakdown etc.

True = Snowpark Python client will try to eliminate the type cast for numeric literals during query generation for binary expression and in expression. False = Snowpark Python client will always add a type cast for numeric literals for query generation.
When True, Snowpark Python client will use locks and thread local objects to protect updates of session object.

Parameter to control the complexity score lower bound used by large query breakdown. When the plan complexity is below this complexity bound, the plan node will not be considered a valid candidate for the optimization.

Parameter to control the complexity score upper bound used by large query breakdown. When the plan complexity is above this bound, the plan will be broken down util plan complexity is below is bound, or no valid nodes can be found.
True = Snowpark Python client will use the CTE optimization for query generation. False = Snowpark Python client will not use CTE optimization for query generation.

When True, Snowpark Python client will use the large query breakdown optimization for breaking down complex snowpark dataframe queries into smaller ones for achieving higher performance. When False, do not breakdown the generated sql queries.

True = Snowpark Python client will use logical type by default in session.create_dataframe to infer timestamp types correctly. False = Snowpark client will fallback to the old behavior. Only affects Python Snowpark version > 1.10.0
True = Python Snowpark will create job scoped temp objects. False = Snowpark will create session temp objects. Only affects Python Snowpark versions > 0.9.0
True = Snowpark Python client will use the SQL simplifier. False = Snowpark Python client will not use SQL simplifier.
Test name if running in QA mode. Used as a diversifier for shared pools
Format used to serialize query result to send back to client
String (up to 2000 characters) used to tag statements executed by the session
If true, the case of quoted identifiers is ignored
If true, queries that read hybrid tables will always see the latest committed writes
maxium number of rows in a result set
S3 VPCE DNS name to access internal stage bucket over privatelink
Search path for unqualified object references.
Change the way external table KIND info is displayed by SHOW TABLES and SHOW OBJECTS. The KIND column of external tables is displayed as TABLE if true, EXTERNAL_TABLE otherwise.
Data sharing views will return rows as if executed in the specified consumer account.
Display the original column names after automatic aliased by Snowpark client. e.g. Join two dataframes with conflicting column names.
Enable lazy result schema analysis for Snowpark
Client side timeout for Snowpark requests in seconds. Currently this parameter only applies to UDF jar (Java/Scala) or zip (Python) file uploading.
If true, it indicates that the query is the final query of table sproc which is used as the result for the client
True = Snowpark will create job scoped temp objects. False = Snowpark will create session temp objects. Only affects JVM Snowpark versions > 1.5.0
The result set may include JSON null if true, otherwise it includes string 'null'
The result set will use the format provided with the default of JSON
Timeout in seconds for queued statements: statements will automatically be canceled if they are queued on a warehouse for longer than this amount of time; disabled if set to zero.
Timeout in seconds for statements: statements are automatically canceled if they run for longer; if set to zero, max value (604800) is enforced.

Trace level value to use when generating/filtering trace events

If this parameter is true, and a statement issued within a non-autocommit
transaction returns with an error, then the non-autocommit transaction is
aborted. All statements issued inside that transaction will fail until an
commit or rollback statement is executed to close that transaction.

The default isolation level when starting a starting a transaction, when no
isolation level was specified

For 2-digit dates, defines a century-start year.
For example, when set to 1980:
  - parsing a string '79' will produce 2079
  - parsing a string '80' will produce 1980

The action to take upon encountering an unsupported ddl statement
If enabled, query results can be reused between successive invocations of the same query as long as the original result has not expired

Defines the first day of the week:
0: legacy Snowflake behavior; 1: Monday .. 7: Sunday.
